channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: How to Get Foam Tips for Your AirPods Pro Without Upgrading
item.dc:creator: Patrick Campanale
item.description: You don't have to pay the Apple tax to get the latest features here.
item.content:encoded: Are you experiencing FOMO by not having foam tips on your older AirPods Pro 1 or 2? Well, I’m here to save the day. You can actually upgrade your previous-generation AirPods Pro with foam tips!

item.title: 3 Ryobi Tools You Should Buy Before Winter
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Be prepared for the cold weather and snowfall.
item.content:encoded: The cold, harsh winter months are quickly approaching, and snow is on the way, which means it's time to get out or upgrade your winter tools. There's no need to manually shovel snow from the driveway when it's freezing, especially when cordless options exist. With that in mind, here are a few cordless winter tools you should buy before winter.

item.title: Stop These 6 Windows Background Processes to Reclaim Your PC's Performance
item.dc:creator: Timothy Jacob Hudson
item.description: Overwhelmed by the number of background processes in your task manager? These are a few you can turn off safely to improve performance.
item.content:encoded: Windows always has a ton of background processes running, and if you're trying to clear up some CPU space and increase your performance, it's hard to know what you can and can't afford to disable. Here are some Windows processes you can turn off without a care in the world in the Services app.

item.title: Most Smart TVs Are Now AI Enhanced, Here's Why You Should Care
item.dc:creator: Maximilian Padilla-Rodriguez
item.description: Smart TVs are getting even smarter.
item.content:encoded: If you've ever looked into buying a smart TV, you've probably noticed that some models are advertised as being AI-enhanced. This label isn't just a marketing gimmick; recent AI-enhanced smart TVs have multiple advantages over ordinary screens, but there are some things you should know before you decide to buy one.

item.title: Remember Chucky? Here's How We Rank Every Child's Play Movie
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: Give Chucky a chance with his top Child’s Play movies ranked for their horror, humor, and terror via toys.
item.content:encoded: Annabelle has nothing on the murderous doll Chucky. Debuting in the late 1980s, the serial killer possessing a toy has become as much of a slasher icon as Freddy Krueger or Jason Vorhees. He might be small, but he’s got a filthy mouth, maniacal laugh, and brutal methods of taking out people three times his size.

item.title: 10 Streaming Services That Cost Less Than $8 a Month
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: Here are some quality streaming services you can easily work into your entertainment budget.
item.content:encoded: Sometimes, choosing the exemplary streaming service has less to do with taste than budget. There are so many options for streaming movies and television, even the abundance of selection isn’t a factor. Of course, plenty of free streaming services exist, but sometimes you want to splurge for something a little without ads.

item.title: This New iPhone Feature Stops Scam Callers—Here's How to Turn It On
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: Say goodbye to nuisance callers for good.
item.content:encoded: It seems hyperbolic to say that nobody answers the phone anymore, but with spam calls reaching unprecedented levels and younger generations who prefer to communicate by text and audio messages, it’s not exactly a false statement.

item.title: This Mini PC Proves That More Power Isn't Always a Good Thing
item.dc:creator: Andrew Heinzman
item.description: It's an impressive mini PC, but you should probably buy something more modest instead.
item.content:encoded: GEEKOM's IT15 is one of the most powerful mini PCs available today. Packed with an Intel Core Ultra 9 285H processor and priced at $1,200, it should be an absolute winner, but I don't think it makes sense beyond some specific professional or hobbyist use cases.

item.title: The NFL Finally Cut the Cord, and It's a Mess
item.dc:creator: Cory Gunther
item.description: Streaming exclusives are making the NFL harder to watch.
item.content:encoded: We're now several weeks into the 2025-26 NFL season, and it's been nothing short of electric. Watching from regular TV stations is still possible, but things are changing. The NFL recently cut the cord and gave YouTube the Sunday Ticket, and several upcoming games will air exclusively on streaming platforms. It's a mess.

item.title: Before Netflix's Frankenstein, Check Out These 10 Movie Monster Makeovers
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: These are the monster movie makeovers that made these dark creatures hog more of the spotlight.
item.content:encoded: Monster movies are entertaining, but there are times when those old monstrosities look a little basic. While it’s essential to pay respect to such classics as Boris Karloff’s Frankenstein’s monster and Bela Lugosi’s Dracula, not all of their scary nature has stood the test of time. Some padded makeup and stuck-on appendages might’ve been enough to scare audiences of the 1930s, but times change, and you need a little more.
